alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Nacogdoches; Rusk; Smith (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 04 at 11:43PM CDT until May 05 at 12:45AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Smith County in northeastern Texas... Western Rusk County in northeastern Texas... Northwestern Nacogdoches County in eastern Texas... Cherokee County in northeastern Texas... * Until 1245 AM CDT. * At 1143 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Brownsboro to Lake Palestine to near Frankston to near Palestine, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Tyler, Jacksonville, Henderson, Whitehouse, Rusk, Overton, Bullard, Troup, Alto, New London, Berryville, Arp, Morrill, Ponta, New Salem, Mount Selman, Joinerville, Sacul, Mixon and Turnertown. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
